title: Whyteleafe FC & Ryman Div1 South
name: Whyteleafe FC & Ryman Div1 South
description:
A Map by Whyteleafefc

All related to Whyteleafe FC and clubs in Ryman League Division 1 South

properties.name: Burgess Hill Town FC (Leylands Park)
properties.description: Posted by Whyteleafefc Stuck in the back of a housing estate (whose residents seemingly hate the club), Burgess Hill Town have a strange selection of supporters. Some are friendly and, well , a bit like us; some are drink-crazed loons intent on demonstrating silly small town aggression and intimidation. Few people seem to look forward to a visit here but really it\'s not that difficult to avoid trouble should one so wish.

properties.name: Chipstead FC
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcOn top of a hill surrounded by enormous houses owned by the stupidly wealthy this football club sits. Promotion to the Ryman League in 2007 arguably reflects the dropping ground grading standards of the league but another local rival is welcome. Be nice if they had a half-decent support however.

properties.name: Church Road, the home of Whyteleafe FC
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcThe home ground of the \'Leafe since 1959. With a dynamic committee under the leadership of secretary Dick Baxendine, the club purchased approximately four acres of farmland in Church Road. Many man hours of voluntary work was required by the committee and the members to raise the funds to not only purchase the land but to finance the change of the ground to a football pitch, as well as convert the existing Farm buildings into a clubhouse with bar and dressing rooms. The original scheme was to include a running track and a cricket table, but these proposals did not prove viable.

properties.name: Croydon Athletic FC
properties.description: Posted by Whyteleafefc Croydon Athletic FC sited in an arse end of Croydon behind the Crematorium and indeed the ground is often affectionately referred to as "the Crem".

properties.name: Croydon FC
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcThe Croydon Arena aka the Legionnaires Arena, home to Croydon FC. Not a popular venue amongst many football fans due largely to its nature as an athletics stadium with a very wide running track. Nonetheless, a just-acceptable view can be had from halfway line straddling stand and the club a small bunch of loyal fans. Tests revealed that the club did not have an outbreak of legionnaires disease in 2005 although The Legionnaires Arena name has a nice ring to it and thus stays. Police were called to the ground on one occasion as someone found "a body" wrapped up in the club\'s car park. It proved to be a dead sheep! Being only a stone\'s throw from Arena tramstop, the ground is very easy to get to by public transport.

properties.name: Horsham YMCA FC (Gorings Mead)
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcA summer fete atmosphere awaits those who visits Goring Mead (at least if they visit in the summer). A friendly club working hard to improve their facilities. There\'s a nasty fence behind one of the goals which doesn\'t really encourage spectators there which is a shame. Gorings Mead is directly behind Horsham FC\'s Queen Street ground.

properties.name: Molesey FC (Walton Road)
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcA ground few people place at the top of their list of fave away trips. Getting there by public transport is a pain - it\'s a route march from Hampton Court. It\'s a decent ground for our level though with a stand that offers a particularly fine view. The rest of the ground is, by contrast, just a bit drab.

properties.name: New Barn Lane (previous ground)
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcIn New Barn Lane lies the ground of Whyteleafe FC from its formation in 1946 until it\'s departure to nearby Church Road in 1959. The pitch and old stand used by the club\'s supporters is still clearly visible from Valley Road.

properties.name: The Foxley Hatch
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcFormerly a good Wetherspoons pub, ideal for meet up en route to Merland Rise (Banstead Athletic and Epsom & Ewell). In recent years however the choice of real has declined, the place has become shabby and the clientèle are just those in seek of a cheap drink (rather than a decent drink).

properties.name: The Old King and Queen
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcArguably the most popular pub in Caterham for \'Leafe fans. Authentic olde worlde charm, friendly staff and customers and good Fullers beer. The pub does not appeal to local low-life and a good time is guaranteed.

properties.name: The Queen's Head
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcQueen\'s Head - a good honest pub close to Ashford Town FC. Decent grub and Summer Lightning. Makes going to homelands worthwhile.

properties.name: The White Hart
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcAn expensive pub-cum-restaurant handy for Chipstead FC.

properties.name: Tooting & Mitcham Utd
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcStark east European style stadium and home to "the Terrors" since 2002. Colour is banned within the ground but for the grass which is painted green due to FA rules. A 5-10 minute walk from Mitcham tramstop makes it easily accessible.

properties.name: Whyteleafe Tavern
properties.description: Posted by WhyteleafefcThe only pub in Whyteleafe generally unpopular with its home supporters with its past reputation. Under new management it may however move back into favour. Visiting supporters are recommended to go straight to \'Leafe\'s own clubhouse where a warm welcome always awaits.
